input_text:
Job Title: Supply Quality Technician 7

Location: Lexington, TN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Quality Assurance

Description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

Core Responsibilities

 Responsible to identify, coordinate and develop suppliers that have opportunities for improving their quality, costs and delivery performance. Assist solving the shop floor production supplier problems. Processes reject and scrap tickets. Spot check, sort and reject incoming supplier shipments as per our procedures. Contacts vendor, supplier. Production management, design and manufacturing engineers to resolve supplier related issues. Verify all drive, transom, machine or engine line scrap which include vendor scrap. Demonstrate strong knowledge of material and purchasing systems. Must operate a forklift ana other material handling equipment. Demonstrates strong problem-solving skills.

Skills And Knowledge Required

 Must have good communication skills both written and verbal. Capable of reading-engineering drawings and-specifications to follow instructions for these documents. Requires full range of vision, hand/eye coordination ana manipulative ability to use tools and equipment. Requires the ability to have advance skills in the use of hand tools - measuring type (calipers, dial calipers, micrometer, height gage, etc. Advance Microsoft and JDE computer skills. Initiate and work with continues improvement. Quality data collection and analysis. Experience in working with excel.

Education And Experience

 High school graduate or equivalent required. Multi-plant experience and cross-functional assignments preferred.

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

Who We Are And What We Believe In

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide. Volvo Group North America is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Affirmative Action employer. E.O.E./M/F/D/V.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join Volvo Group. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

Volvo Penta, a world-leading supplier of engines and complete drive systems for marine and industrial applications, you will be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals who works with passion, trust each other and embraces change to stay ahead. We make our customers win.

Experience Level (if available): None

Verify drive, transom, machine, or engine line scrap including vendor scrap
Demonstrate strong knowledge of material and purchasing systems
Operate forklifts and other material handling equipment
Use advanced Microsoft and JDE computer skills
Initiate and work with continuous improvement
